availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, shoemaker. Native of Ireland. Married to Catherine Shanley. Father of Mary J. Shanley, Thomas B. Shanley, Celia Shanley, James Shanley, Richard Shanley, and Anna Shanley. Shoemaker in Nelson County, in 1860. Postmaster of Fairfield in Nelson County from January 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 258.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Fairfield, p. 136A.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, vol. 45, Martin-Pike County, p. 275 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
